title: Replacing the Top of a Rain Bird Valve

subtasks: Check if replacement of entire valve is necessary
Purchase solenoid and diaphragm separately if possible
Consider cost and effectiveness of replacing only the top parts
Turn off water supply to the irrigation system
Remove wires connected to the solenoid
Disassemble the old valve by removing screws and cleaning
Prepare the new diaphragm and spring
Ensure correct orientation of the diaphragm on the old valve
Reassemble the valve with new diaphragm and spring
Connect the solenoid wires to the correct terminals
Secure the valve assembly and backfill the valve box
Visit Sprinkler Warehouse website for products
Chat with customer service for assistance
Inspect and troubleshoot valves as needed
Regularly inspect valve boxes and replace worn parts
Properly backfill and secure valve boxes after repairs
